title: Taylor Swift knew she would lose Les Miserables role to Samantha Barks
text:
Samantha Barks and Taylor Swift both auditioned for Eponine (Picture: Working Title/Getty)

Taylor Swift has spoken again about her audition in 2012 for Tom Hooper’s Les Miserable admitting she knew immediately she would not get the role.

The singer, at the time about to release her fourth album Red, auditioned for lead role of Eponine but ultimately lost out to West End star Samantha Barks.

However, it wasn’t to be and now seven years later she has finally worked with Tom on the upcoming Cats adaptation.

‘I really wanted to work with Tom Hooper. I know that he records live and he films and records your vocals live. It’s such an interesting thing to me and I wanted to see him work and I wanted to be a part of that,’ she said.

‘I had actually done screen tests for Les Mis and had met him through that process.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Like 2012. I didn’t get it but it was such an amazing experience just doing the screen test and I was obviously like, “I’m not going to get this.”’

Sam Barks got the role over Taylor (Picture: Working Title)

She added: ‘Because the other girl was amazing and was on the West End. Samantha Barks, she’s incredible and she fully killed the role and was amazing.

‘I was watching it being like, “This is incredible.” I just had a good time doing the screen tests and because Tom Hooper was in all these screen tests and I was just like, “This is so phenomenal.”‘

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Shake It Off singer will now star as Bombalurina in the movie and has penned Beautiful Ghosts for the upcoming film – which will be performed by Francesca Hayward and also Dame Judi Dench.

But, despite her character not singing it in the film, the 29-year-old will be belting out the track over the credits, so fans will still be able to hear her in action.

Speaking to New Music Daily with Zane Lowe on Apple Music’s Beats 1, she added: ‘I love musical theatre. I started out doing musical theatre as a kid. It’s what made me fall in love with performing as a medium.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘And so basically when I was approached this time, it was a straight-up offer. And I love kitty cats and the situation just kept getting more interesting because I accepted the role.

‘They show us this demo of this digital fur that they’re adding to us. And I was like, “Yes”.’

Cats the movie will be out on 20 December, with the trailer dividing viewers earlier this year.

But the recent tease of Beautiful Ghosts – as well as Taylor’s vocals – in a video shared on the film’s official Twitter page, has some fans predicting Oscars success in her future.

description: Taylor Swift auditioned for Eponine in Tom Hooper's 2012 version of Les Miserables.
